questions.question: …………………….. people want a new system.
questions.description: We use most before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: She is the nicest ……………………… them all.
questions.description: After superlatives we use of before plurals.

questions.question: It was ten times …………………………. difficult than I expected.
It would be better if we …………………………. it the other way up.
questions.description: When the verb in the if clause is in the simple past tense, we use would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: This doesn’t ……………………… very nice.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after do, does and did.

questions.question: I don’t like ……………………….. of my grammar teachers.
Either Peter or Jack ……………………… here in the morning.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either…or.

questions.question: I’m ……………………… a phone call from my boss at
questions.description: We wait when somebody or something is late.

questions.question: Mumbai is ………………………… away than Bangalore.
questions.description: Both further and farther can be used to talk about distance.

questions.question: I always felt ………………………… when I was with him.
questions.description: Feel is a copular verb. We use adjectives, not adverbs to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: We ……………………… to Greece next week.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about personal arrangements.

questions.question: ………………………… having a headache, I enjoyed the film.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition and we use a preposition before a noun or an ing form.
